options.title: _module.args
options.type: lazy attribute set of raw value

options.title: accounts.email.accounts
options.description: List of email accounts.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.address
options.description: The email address of this account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.enable
options.description: Whether to enable aerc.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.extraAccounts
options.description: Extra config added to the configuration of this account in$HOME/.config/aerc/accounts.conf.See aerc-config(5).
options.type: attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string of float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.extraBinds
options.description: Extra bindings specific to this account, added to$HOME/.config/aerc/accounts.conf.See aerc-config(5).
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string of float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.extraConfig
options.description: Extra config specific to this account, added to$HOME/.config/aerc/aerc.conf.See aerc-config(5).
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string of float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.smtpAuth
options.description: Sets the authentication mechanism if smtp is used as the outgoingmethod.See aerc-smtp(5).

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aliases
options.description: Alternative email addresses of this account.
options.type: list of string matching the pattern .*@.*

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.alot.contactCompletion
options.description: Contact completion configuration as expected per alot.See alot's wiki forexplanation about possible values.
options.default: { command = "'\${pkgs.notmuch}/bin/notmuch address --format=json --output=recipients date:6M..'"; regexp = '''\[?{"name": "(?P<name>.*)", "address": "(?P<email>.+)", "name-addr": ".*"}[,\]]?'''; shellcommand_external_filtering = "False"; type = "shellcommand"; }

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.alot.extraConfig
options.description: Extra settings to add to this Alot account configuration.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.alot.sendMailCommand
options.description: Command to send a mail. If msmtp is enabled for the account,then this is set tomsmtpq --read-envelope-from --read-recipients.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.astroid.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Astroid.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.astroid.extraConfig
options.description: Extra settings to add to this astroid account configuration.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.astroid.sendMailCommand
options.description: Command to send a mail. If msmtp is enabled for the account,then this is set tomsmtpq --read-envelope-from --read-recipients.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.flavor
options.description: Some email providers have peculiar behavior that requirespecial treatment. This option is therefore intended toindicate the nature of the provider.
options.note:
When this indicates a specific provider then, for example,
the IMAP, SMTP, and JMAP server configuration may be set
automatically.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.folders
options.description: Standard email folders.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.folders.drafts
options.description: Relative path of the drafts mail folder.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.folders.inbox
options.description: Relative path of the inbox mail.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.folders.sent
options.description: Relative path of the sent mail folder.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.folders.trash
options.description: Relative path of the deleted mail folder.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.getmail.enable
options.description: Whether to enable the getmail mail retriever for this account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.getmail.delete
options.description: Enable if you want to delete read messages from the server. Mostusers should either enable delete or disablereadAll.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.getmail.destinationCommand
options.description: Specify a command delivering the incoming mail to your maildir.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.getmail.mailboxes
options.description: A non-empty list of mailboxes. To download all mail you canuse the ALL mailbox.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.getmail.readAll
options.description: Enable if you want to fetch all, even the read messages from theserver. Most users should either enable delete ordisable readAll.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.gpg
options.description: GPG configuration.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.gpg.encryptByDefault
options.description: Encrypt outgoing messages by default.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.gpg.key
options.description: The key to use as listed in gpg --list-keys.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.gpg.signByDefault
options.description: Sign messages by default.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.himalaya.enable
options.description: Whether to enable the himalaya mail client for this account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.himalaya.settings
options.description: Extra settings to add to this himalayaaccount configuration.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap
options.description: The IMAP configuration to use for this account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap.host
options.description: Hostname of IMAP server.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap.port
options.description: The port on which the IMAP server listens. Ifnull then the default port is used.
options.type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap.tls
options.description: Configuration for secure connections.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap.tls.enable
options.description: Whether to enable TLS/SSL.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap.tls.certificatesFile
options.description: Path to file containing certificate authorities that shouldbe used to validate the connection authenticity. Ifnull then the system default is used.Note, if set then the system default may still be accepted.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap.tls.useStartTls
options.description: Whether to use STARTTLS.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imapnotify.enable
options.description: Whether to enable imapnotify.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imapnotify.boxes
options.description: IMAP folders to watch.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imapnotify.extraConfig
options.description: Additional configuration to add for this account.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imapnotify.onNotify
options.description: Shell commands to run on any event.
options.type: string or attribute set of string

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imapnotify.onNotifyPost
options.description: Shell commands to run after onNotify event.
options.type: string or attribute set of string

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.jmap
options.description: The JMAP configuration to use for this account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.jmap.host
options.description: Hostname of JMAP server.
options.note:
If both this option and accounts.email.accounts.<name>.jmap.sessionUrl are specified,
host is preferred by applications when establishing a
session.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.jmap.sessionUrl
options.description: URL for the JMAP Session resource.
options.note:
If both this option and accounts.email.accounts.<name>.jmap.host are specified,
host is preferred by applications when establishing a
session.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.enable
options.description: Whether to enable lieer Gmail synchronization for notmuch.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.notmuchSetupWarning
options.description: Warn if Notmuch is not also enabled for this account.
options.note:
This can safely be disabled if notmuch init
has been used to configure this account outside of Home
Manager.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings
options.description: Settings which are applied to .gmailieer.jsonfor the account.
options.note:
See the lieer manual
for documentation of settings not explicitly covered by this module.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.drop_non_existing_label
options.description: Allow missing labels on the Gmail side to be dropped.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.file_extension
options.description: Extension to include in local file names, which can be usefulfor indexing with third-party programs.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.ignore_empty_history
options.description: Work around a Gmail API quirk where an empty change historyis sometimes returned.
options.note:
See this
GitHub issue
for more details.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.ignore_remote_labels
options.description: Set Gmail labels to ignore when syncing from remote labels tolocal tags (before translations).

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.ignore_tags
options.description: Set labels to ignore when syncing from local tags toremote labels (after translations).

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.local_trash_tag
options.description: Local tag to which the remote Gmail 'TRASH' label is translated.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.remove_local_messages
options.description: Remove local messages that have been deleted on the remote.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.replace_slash_with_dot
options.description: Replace '/' with '.' in Gmail labels.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.timeout
options.description: HTTP timeout in seconds. 0 means forever or system timeout.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.sync.enable
options.description: Whether to enable lieer synchronization service.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.sync.frequency
options.description: How often to synchronize the account.
options.note:
This value is passed to the systemd timer configuration as the
onCalendar option. See
systemd.time(7)
for more information about the format.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.maildir
options.description: Maildir configuration for this account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.maildir.path
options.description: Path to maildir directory where mail for this account isstored. This is relative to the base maildir path.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.enable
options.description: Whether to enable synchronization using mbsync.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.create
options.description: Automatically create missing mailboxes within thegiven mail store.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.expunge
options.description: Permanently remove messages marked for deletion fromthe given mail store.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.extraConfig.account
options.description: Account section extra configuration.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.extraConfig.channel
options.description: Per channel extra configuration.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.extraConfig.local
options.description: Local store extra configuration.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.extraConfig.remote
options.description: Remote store extra configuration.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.flatten
options.description: If set, flattens the hierarchy within the maildir bysubstituting the canonical hierarchy delimiter/ with this value.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups
options.description: Some email providers (Gmail) have a different directory hierarchy forsynchronized email messages. Namely, when using mbsync without specifyinga set of channels into a group, all synchronized directories end up beneaththe [Gmail]/ directory.
options.note:
This option allows you to specify a group, and subsequently channels that
will allow you to sync your mail into an arbitrary hierarchy.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.channels
options.description: List of channels that should be grouped together into this group. Whenperforming a synchronization, the groups are synchronized, rather thanthe individual channels.
options.note:
Using these channels and then grouping them together allows for you to
define the maildir hierarchy as you see fit.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.channels.<name>.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration lines to add to THIS channel'sconfiguration.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.channels.<name>.farPattern
options.description: IMAP4 patterns for which mailboxes on the remote mail server to sync.If Patterns are specified, farPatternis interpreted as a prefix which is not matched against the patterns,and is not affected by mailbox list overrides.
options.note:
If this is left as the default, then mbsync will default to the pattern
INBOX.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.channels.<name>.name
options.description: The unique name for THIS channel in THIS group. The group will refer tothis channel by this name.
options.note:
In addition, you can manually sync just this channel by specifying this
name to mbsync on the command line.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.channels.<name>.nearPattern
options.description: Name for where mail coming from the remote (far) mail server will end uplocally. The mailbox specified by the far pattern will be placed inthis directory.
options.note:
If this is left as the default, then mbsync will default to the pattern
INBOX.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.channels.<name>.patterns
options.description: Instead of synchronizing just the mailboxes thatmatch the farPattern, use it as a prefix which isnot matched against the patterns, and is not affected by mailbox listoverrides.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.name
options.description: The name of this group for this account. These names are different thansome others, because they will hide channel names that are the same.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.patterns
options.description: Pattern of mailboxes to synchronize.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.remove
options.description: Propagate mailbox deletions to the given mail store.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.subFolders
options.description: The on-disk folder naming style. This option has noeffect when flatten is used.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.msmtp.enable
options.description: Whether to enable msmtp.
options.note:
If enabled then it is possible to use the
--account command line
option to send a message for a given account using the
msmtp or msmtpq tool.
For example, msmtp --account=private would
send using the account defined in
accounts.email.accounts.private. If the
--account option is not
given then the primary account will be used.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.msmtp.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration options to add to ~/.msmtprc.See https://marlam.de/msmtp/msmtprc.txt forexamples.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.msmtp.tls.fingerprint
options.description: Fingerprint of a trusted TLS certificate.The fingerprint can be obtained by executingmsmtp --serverinfo --tls --tls-certcheck=off.
options.type: null or string matching the pattern ([[:alnum:]]{2}:)+[[:alnum:]]{2}

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mu.enable
options.description: Whether to enable mu indexing.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.enable
options.description: Whether to enable mujmap JMAP synchronization for notmuch.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.notmuchSetupWarning
options.description: Warn if Notmuch is not also enabled for this account.
options.note:
This can safely be disabled if mujmap.toml is managed
outside of Home Manager.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings
options.description: Settings which are applied to mujmap.tomlfor the account.
options.note:
See the mujmap project
for documentation of settings not explicitly covered by this module.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.auto_create_new_mailboxes
options.description: Whether to create new mailboxes automatically on the server from notmuchtags.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.cache_dir
options.description: The cache directory in which to store mail files while they are beingdownloaded. The default is operating-system specific.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.fqdn
options.description: Fully qualified domain name of the JMAP service.
options.note:
mujmap looks up the JMAP SRV record for this host to determine the JMAP session
URL. Mutually exclusive with
accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.session_url.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.password_command
options.description: Shell command which will print a password to stdout for basic HTTPauthentication.
options.note:
If null, defaults to
accounts.email.accounts.<name>.passwordCommand.
options.type: null or string or list of string

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.session_url
options.description: Sesion URL to connect to.
options.note:
Mutually exclusive with
accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.fqdn.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags
options.description: Tag configuration.
options.note:
Beware that there are quirks that require manual consideration if changing the
values of these files; please see
https://github.com/elizagamedev/mujmap/blob/main/mujmap.toml.example
for more details.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.deleted
options.description: Tag for notmuch to use for messages stored in the mailbox labeled with theTrash name attribute.
options.note:
If set to an empty string, this mailbox and its child
mailboxes are not synchronized with a tag.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.directory_separator
options.description: Directory separator for mapping notmuch tags to maildirs.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.important
options.description: Tag for notmuch to use for messages stored in the mailbox labeled with theImportant name attribute and/or with the $Importantkeyword.
options.note:
If set to an empty string, this mailbox, its child
mailboxes, and these keywords are not synchronized with a tag.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.inbox
options.description: Tag for notmuch to use for messages stored in the mailbox labeled with theInbox name attribute.
options.note:
If set to an empty string, this mailbox and its child
mailboxes are not synchronized with a tag.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.lowercase
options.description: If true, translate all mailboxes to lowercase names when mapping to notmuchtags.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.phishing
options.description: Tag for notmuch to use for the IANA $Phishing keyword.
options.note: If set to an empty string, this keyword is not synchronized with a tag.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.sent
options.description: Tag for notmuch to use for messages stored in the mailbox labeled with theSent name attribute.
options.note:
If set to an empty string, this mailbox and its child
mailboxes are not synchronized with a tag.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.spam
options.description: Tag for notmuch to use for messages stored in the mailbox labeled with theJunk name attribute and/or with the $Junk keyword,except for messages with the $NotJunk keyword.
options.note:
If set to an empty string, this mailbox, its child
mailboxes, and these keywords are not synchronized with a tag.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.username
options.description: Username for basic HTTP authentication.
options.note:
If null, defaults to
accounts.email.accounts.<name>.userName.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.name
options.description: Unique identifier of the account. This is set to theattribute name of the account configuration.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.neomutt.enable
options.description: Whether to enable NeoMutt.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.neomutt.extraConfig
options.description: Extra lines to add to the folder hook for this account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.neomutt.extraMailboxes
options.description: List of extra mailboxes

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.neomutt.mailboxName
options.description: Use a different name as mailbox name

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.neomutt.sendMailCommand
options.description: Command to send a mail. If not set, neomutt will be in charge of sending mails.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.notmuch.enable
options.description: Whether to enable notmuch indexing.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.offlineimap.enable
options.description: Whether to enable OfflineIMAP.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.offlineimap.extraConfig.account
options.description: Extra configuration options to add to the account section.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.offlineimap.extraConfig.local
options.description: Extra configuration options to add to the local accountsection.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.offlineimap.extraConfig.remote
options.description: Extra configuration options to add to the remote accountsection.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.offlineimap.postSyncHookCommand
options.description: Command to run after fetching new mails.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.passwordCommand
options.description: A command, which when run writes the account password onstandard output.
options.type: null or string or list of string

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.primary
options.description: Whether this is the primary account. Only one account may beset as primary.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.realName
options.description: Name displayed when sending mails.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.signature
options.description: Signature configuration.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.signature.command
options.description: A command that generates a signature.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.signature.showSignature
options.description: Method to communicate the signature.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.signature.text
options.description: Signature content.
options.example:
''
--
Luke Skywalker
May the force be with you.
''

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.smtp
options.description: The SMTP configuration to use for this account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.smtp.host
options.description: Hostname of SMTP server.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.smtp.port
options.description: The port on which the SMTP server listens. Ifnull then the default port is used.
options.type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.smtp.tls
options.description: Configuration for secure connections.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.smtp.tls.enable
options.description: Whether to enable TLS/SSL.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.smtp.tls.certificatesFile
options.description: Path to file containing certificate authorities that shouldbe used to validate the connection authenticity. Ifnull then the system default is used.Note, if set then the system default may still be accepted.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.smtp.tls.useStartTls
options.description: Whether to use STARTTLS.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.thunderbird.enable
options.description: Whether to enable the Thunderbird mail client for this account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.thunderbird.profiles
options.description: List of Thunderbird profiles for which this account should beenabled. If this list is empty (the default), this account willbe enabled for all declared profiles.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.thunderbird.settings
options.description: Extra settings to add to this Thunderbird account configuration.The id given as argument is an automaticallygenerated account identifier.
options.type: function that evaluates to a(n) attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.userName
options.description: The server username of this account. This will be used asthe SMTP, IMAP, and JMAP user name.

options.title: accounts.email.certificatesFile
options.description: Path to default file containing certificate authorities thatshould be used to validate the connection authenticity. Thispath may be overridden on a per-account basis.

options.title: accounts.email.maildirBasePath
options.description: The base directory for account maildir directories. May be arelative path, in which case it is relative the homedirectory.

options.title: dconf.settings
options.description: Settings to write to the dconf configuration system.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (GVariant value)

options.title: editorconfig.enable
options.description: Whether to enable EditorConfig home configuration file.

options.title: editorconfig.settings
options.description: Configuration written to $HOME/.editorconfig.root = true is automatically added to the file,it must not be added here.See https://editorconfig.org for documentation.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))

options.title: fonts.fontconfig.enable
options.description: Whether to enable fontconfig configuration. This will, forexample, allow fontconfig to discover fonts andconfigurations installed throughhome.packages andnix-env.

options.title: gtk.enable
options.description: Whether to enable GTK 2/3 configuration.

options.title: gtk.cursorTheme
options.description: The cursor theme to use.

options.title: gtk.cursorTheme.package
options.description: Package providing the cursor theme. This package will be installedto your profile. If null then the themeis assumed to already be available in your profile.

options.title: gtk.cursorTheme.name
options.description: The name of the cursor theme within the package.

options.title: gtk.cursorTheme.size
options.description: The size of the cursor.

options.title: gtk.font
options.description: The font to use in GTK+ 2/3 applications.

options.title: gtk.font.package
options.description: Package providing the font. This package will be installedto your profile. If null then the fontis assumed to already be available in your profile.

options.title: gtk.font.name
options.description: The family name of the font within the package.

options.title: gtk.font.size
options.description: The size of the font.

options.title: gtk.gtk2.configLocation
options.description: The location to put the GTK configuration file.

options.title: gtk.gtk2.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration lines to add verbatim to~/.gtkrc-2.0.

options.title: gtk.gtk3.bookmarks
options.description: Bookmarks in the sidebar of the GTK file browser

options.title: gtk.gtk3.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration options to add to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/gtk-3.0/settings.ini.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)

options.title: gtk.gtk3.extraCss
options.description: Extra configuration lines to add verbatim to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/gtk-3.0/gtk.css.

options.title: gtk.gtk4.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration options to add to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/gtk-4.0/settings.ini.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)

options.title: gtk.iconTheme
options.description: The icon theme to use.

options.title: gtk.iconTheme.package
options.description: Package providing the icon theme. This package will be installedto your profile. If null then the themeis assumed to already be available in your profile.

options.title: gtk.iconTheme.name
options.description: The name of the icon theme within the package.

options.title: gtk.theme
options.description: The GTK+2/3 theme to use.

options.title: gtk.theme.package
options.description: Package providing the theme. This package will be installedto your profile. If null then the themeis assumed to already be available in your profile.

options.title: gtk.theme.name
options.description: The name of the theme within the package.

options.title: home.enableDebugInfo
options.description: Some Nix-packages provide debug symbols forgdb in the debug-output.This option ensures that those are automatically fetched fromthe binary cache if available and gdb isconfigured to find those symbols.

options.title: home.enableNixpkgsReleaseCheck
options.description: Determines whether to check for release version mismatch between HomeManager and Nixpkgs. Using mismatched versions is likely to cause errorsand unexpected behavior. It is therefore highly recommended to use arelease of Home Manager than corresponds with your chosen release ofNixpkgs.
options.note:
When this option is enabled and a mismatch is detected then a warning
will be printed when the user configuration is being built.

options.title: home.packages
options.description: The set of packages to appear in the user environment.

options.title: home.activation
options.description: The activation scripts blocks to run when activating a HomeManager generation. Any entry here should be idempotent,meaning running twice or more times produces the same resultas running it once.
options.note:
If the script block produces any observable side effect, such
as writing or deleting files, then it
must be placed after the special
writeBoundary script block. Prior to the
write boundary one can place script blocks that verifies, but
does not modify, the state of the system and exits if an
unexpected state is found. For example, the
checkLinkTargets script block checks for
collisions between non-managed files and files defined in
home.file.

options.title: home.extraOutputsToInstall
options.description: List of additional package outputs of the packageshome.packages that should be installed intothe user environment.

options.title: home.file
options.description: Attribute set of files to link into the user home.

options.title: home.file.<name>.executable
options.description: Set the execute bit. If null, defaults to the modeof the source file or to falsefor files created through the text option.

options.title: home.file.<name>.onChange
options.description: Shell commands to run when file has changed betweengenerations. The script will be runafter the new files have been linkedinto place.
options.note:
Note, this code is always run when recursive is
enabled.

options.title: home.file.<name>.recursive
options.description: If the file source is a directory, then this optiondetermines whether the directory should be recursivelylinked to the target location. This option has no effectif the source is a file.
options.note:
If false (the default) then the target
will be a symbolic link to the source directory. If
true then the target will be a
directory structure matching the source's but whose leafs
are symbolic links to the files of the source directory.

options.title: home.file.<name>.source
options.description: Path of the source file or directory. Ifhome.file.<name>.textis non-null then this option will automatically point to a filecontaining that text.

options.title: home.file.<name>.target
options.description: Path to target file relative to HOME.

options.title: home.file.<name>.text
options.description: Text of the file. If this option is null thenhome.file.<name>.sourcemust be set.

options.title: home.homeDirectory
options.description: The user's home directory. Must be an absolute path.

options.title: home.keyboard
options.description: Keyboard configuration. Set to null todisable Home Manager keyboard management.

options.title: home.keyboard.layout
options.description: Keyboard layout. If null, then the systemconfiguration will be used.
options.note:
This defaults to null for state
version ≥ 19.09 and "us" otherwise.

options.title: home.keyboard.model
options.description: Keyboard model.

options.title: home.keyboard.options
options.description: X keyboard options; layout switching goes here.

options.title: home.keyboard.variant
options.description: X keyboard variant. If null, then thesystem configuration will be used.
options.note:
This defaults to null for state
version ≥ 19.09 and "" otherwise.

options.title: home.language
options.description: Language configuration.

options.title: home.language.address
options.description: The language to use for addresses.

options.title: home.language.base
options.description: The language to use unless overridden by a more specific option.

options.title: home.language.collate
options.description: The language to use for collation (alphabetical ordering).

options.title: home.language.ctype
options.description: Character classification category.

options.title: home.language.measurement
options.description: The language to use for measurement values.

options.title: home.language.messages
options.description: The language to use for messages, application UI languages, etc.

options.title: home.language.monetary
options.description: The language to use for formatting currencies and money amounts.

options.title: home.language.name
options.description: The language to use for personal names.

options.title: home.language.numeric
options.description: The language to use for numerical values.

options.title: home.language.paper
options.description: The language to use for paper sizes.

options.title: home.language.telephone
options.description: The language to use for telephone numbers.

options.title: home.language.time
options.description: The language to use for formatting times.

options.title: home.pointerCursor
options.description: Cursor configuration. Set to null to disable.
options.note:
Top-level options declared under this submodule are backend indepedent
options. Options declared under namespaces such as x11
are backend specific options. By default, only backend independent cursor
configurations are generated. If you need configurations for specific
backends, you can toggle them via the enable option. For example,
home.pointerCursor.x11.enable
will enable x11 cursor configurations.

options.title: home.pointerCursor.package
options.description: Package providing the cursor theme.

options.title: home.pointerCursor.gtk.enable
options.description: Whether to enable gtk config generation for home.pointerCursor.

options.title: home.pointerCursor.name
options.description: The cursor name within the package.

options.title: home.pointerCursor.size
options.description: The cursor size.

options.title: home.pointerCursor.x11.enable
options.description: Whether to enable x11 config generation for home.pointerCursor.

options.title: home.pointerCursor.x11.defaultCursor
options.description: The default cursor file to use within the package.

options.title: home.profileDirectory
options.description: The profile directory where Home Manager generations are installed.

options.title: home.sessionPath
options.description: Extra directories to add to PATH.
options.note:
These directories are added to the PATH variable in a
double-quoted context, so expressions like $HOME are
expanded by the shell. However, since expressions like ~ or
* are escaped, they will end up in the PATH
verbatim.

options.title: home.sessionVariables
options.description: Environment variables to always set at login.
options.note:
The values may refer to other environment variables using
POSIX.2 style variable references. For example, a variable
parameter may be referenced as
$parameter or ${parameter}. A
default value foo may be given as per
${parameter:-foo} and, similarly, an alternate
value bar can be given as per
${parameter:+bar}.

options.title: home.shellAliases
options.description: An attribute set that maps aliases (the top level attribute namesin this option) to command strings or directly to build outputs.
options.note:
This option should only be used to manage simple aliases that are
compatible across all shells. If you need to use a shell specific
feature then make sure to use a shell specific option, for example
programs.bash.shellAliases for Bash.

options.title: home.stateVersion
options.description: It is occasionally necessary for Home Manager to changeconfiguration defaults in a way that is incompatible withstateful data. This could, for example, include switching thedefault data format or location of a file.
options.note:
The state version indicates which default
settings are in effect and will therefore help avoid breaking
program configurations. Switching to a higher state version
typically requires performing some manual steps, such as data
conversion or moving files.

options.title: home.username
options.description: The user's username.

options.title: i18n.inputMethod.enabled
options.description: Select the enabled input method. Input methods is a software to inputsymbols that are not available on standard input devices.
options.note:
Input methods are specially used to input Chinese, Japanese and Korean
characters.

options.description: A customizable lightweight input method    extra input engines can be added using    i18n.inputMethod.fcitx.engines.
The next generation of fcitx,    addons (including engines, dictionaries, skins) can be added using    i18n.inputMethod.fcitx5.addons.
A Korean input method based on XIM. Nabi doesn't support Qt 5.
The universal input method, is a library with a XIM bridge.    uim mainly support Chinese, Japanese and Korean.
An extremely easy-to-use input method framework.
A Korean IME.

options.title: i18n.inputMethod.fcitx.engines
options.description: Enabled Fcitx engines. Available engines are: anthy, chewing, cloudpinyin, hangul, libpinyin, m17n, mozc, rime, skk, table-extra, table-other, unikey.

options.title: i18n.inputMethod.fcitx5.addons
options.description: Enabled Fcitx5 addons.

options.title: i18n.inputMethod.kime.config
options.description: kime configuration. Refer tohttps://github.com/Riey/kime/blob/develop/docs/CONFIGURATION.mdfor details on supported values.

options.title: i18n.inputMethod.uim.toolbar
options.description: Selected UIM toolbar.

options.title: launchd.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Home Manager to define per-user daemons by making useof launchd's LaunchAgents.

options.title: launchd.agents
options.description: Define LaunchAgents.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.enable
options.description: Whether to enable ‹name›.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config
options.description: Define a launchd job. See launchd.plist(5) for details.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.AbandonProcessGroup
options.description: When a job dies, launchd kills any remaining processes with the same process group ID as the job.  Set-ting Settingting this key to true disables that behavior.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Debug
options.description: This optional key specifies that launchd should adjust its log mask temporarily to LOG_DEBUG whiledealing with this job.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Disabled
options.description: This optional key is used as a hint to launchctl(1) that it should not submit this job to launchd whenloading a job or jobs. The value of this key does NOT reflect the current state of the job on the run-ning runningning system. If you wish to know whether a job is loaded in launchd, reading this key from a configura-tion configurationtion file yourself is not a sufficient test. You should query launchd for the presence of the job usingthe launchctl(1) list subcommand or use the ServiceManagement framework'sSMJobCopyDictionary() method.Note that as of Mac OS X v10.6, this key's value in a configuration file conveys a default value, whichis changed with the [-w] option of the launchctl(1) load and unload subcommands. These subcommands nolonger modify the configuration file, so the value displayed in the configuration file is not necessar-ily necessarilyily the value that launchctl(1) will apply. See launchctl(1) for more information.Please also be mindful that you should only use this key if the provided on-demand and KeepAlive crite-ria criteriaria are insufficient to describe the conditions under which your job needs to run. The cost to have ajob loaded in launchd is negligible, so there is no harm in loading a job which only runs once or veryrarely.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.EnableGlobbing
options.description: This flag causes launchd to use the glob(3) mechanism to update the program arguments before invoca-tion. invocation.tion.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.EnableTransactions
options.description: This flag instructs launchd that the job promises to use vproc_transaction_begin(3) andvproc_transaction_end(3) to track outstanding transactions that need to be reconciled before theprocess can safely terminate. If no outstanding transactions are in progress, then launchd is free tosend the SIGKILL signal.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.EnvironmentVariables
options.description: This optional key is used to specify additional environment variables to be set before running thejob.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.ExitTimeOut
options.description: The amount of time launchd waits before sending a SIGKILL signal. The default value is 20 seconds. Thevalue zero is interpreted as infinity.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.GroupName
options.description: This optional key specifies the group to run the job as. This key is only applicable when launchd isrunning as root. If UserName is set and GroupName is not, the the group will be set to the defaultgroup of the user.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits
options.description: Resource limits to be imposed on the job. These adjust variables set with setrlimit(2).  The followingkeys apply:

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.CPU
options.description: The maximum amount of cpu time (in seconds) to be used by each process.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.Core
options.description: The largest size (in bytes) core file that may be created.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.Data
options.description: The maximum size (in bytes) of the data segment for a process; this defines how far a program mayextend its break with the sbrk(2) system call.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.FileSize
options.description: The largest size (in bytes) file that may be created.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.MemoryLock
options.description: The maximum size (in bytes) which a process may lock into memory using the mlock(2) function.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.NumberOfFiles
options.description: The maximum number of open files for this process.  Setting this value in a system wide daemonwill set the sysctl(3) kern.maxfiles (SoftResourceLimits) or kern.maxfilesperproc (HardResource-Limits) (HardResourceLimits)Limits) value in addition to the setrlimit(2) values.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.NumberOfProcesses
options.description: The maximum number of simultaneous processes for this user id.  Setting this value in a systemwide daemon will set the sysctl(3) kern.maxproc (SoftResourceLimits) or kern.maxprocperuid(HardResourceLimits) value in addition to the setrlimit(2) values.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.ResidentSetSize
options.description: The maximum size (in bytes) to which a process's resident set size may grow.  This imposes alimit on the amount of physical memory to be given to a process; if memory is tight, the systemwill prefer to take memory from processes that are exceeding their declared resident set size.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.Stack
options.description: The maximum size (in bytes) of the stack segment for a process; this defines how far a program'sstack segment may be extended.  Stack extension is performed automatically by the system.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.InitGroups
options.description: This optional key specifies whether initgroups(3) should be called before running the job.  The defaultis true in 10.5 and false in 10.4. This key will be ignored if the UserName key is not set.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.KeepAlive
options.description: This optional key is used to control whether your job is to be kept continuously running or to letdemand and conditions control the invocation. The default is false and therefore only demand will startthe job. The value may be set to true to unconditionally keep the job alive. Alternatively, a dictio-nary dictionarynary of conditions may be specified to selectively control whether launchd keeps a job alive or not. Ifmultiple keys are provided, launchd ORs them, thus providing maximum flexibility to the job to refinethe logic and stall if necessary. If launchd finds no reason to restart the job, it falls back ondemand based invocation.  Jobs that exit quickly and frequently when configured to be kept alive willbe throttled to converve system resources.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Label
options.description: This required key uniquely identifies the job to launchd.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LaunchOnlyOnce
options.description: This optional key specifies whether the job can only be run once and only once.  In other words, if thejob cannot be safely respawned without a full machine reboot, then set this key to be true.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LimitLoadFromHosts
options.description: This configuration file only applies to hosts NOT listed with this key. Note: One should set kern.host-name kern.hostnamename in sysctl.conf(5) for this feature to work reliably.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LimitLoadToHosts
options.description: This configuration file only applies to the hosts listed with this key. Note: One should set kern.host-name kern.hostnamename in sysctl.conf(5) for this feature to work reliably.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LimitLoadToSessionType
options.description: This configuration file only applies to sessions of the type specified. This key is used in concertwith the -S flag to launchctl.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LowPriorityIO
options.description: This optional key specifies whether the kernel should consider this daemon to be low priority whendoing file system I/O.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.MachServices
options.description: This optional key is used to specify Mach services to be registered with the Mach bootstrap sub-system.Each key in this dictionary should be the name of service to be advertised. The value of the key mustbe a boolean and set to true.  Alternatively, a dictionary can be used instead of a simple true value.Finally, for the job itself, the values will be replaced with Mach ports at the time of check-in withlaunchd.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.MachServices.HideUntilCheckIn
options.description: Reserve the name in the namespace, but cause bootstrap_look_up() to fail until the job haschecked in with launchd.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.MachServices.ResetAtClose
options.description: If this boolean is false, the port is recycled, thus leaving clients to remain oblivious to thedemand nature of job. If the value is set to true, clients receive port death notifications whenthe job lets go of the receive right. The port will be recreated atomically with respect to boot-strap_look_up() bootstrap_look_up()strap_look_up() calls, so that clients can trust that after receiving a port death notification,the new port will have already been recreated. Setting the value to true should be done withcare. Not all clients may be able to handle this behavior. The default value is false.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Nice
options.description: This optional key specifies what nice(3) value should be applied to the daemon.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.OnDemand
options.description: This key was used in Mac OS X 10.4 to control whether a job was kept alive or not. The default wastrue.  This key has been deprecated and replaced in Mac OS X 10.5 and later with the more powerfulKeepAlive option.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.ProcessType
options.description: This optional key describes, at a high level, the intended purpose of the job.  The system will applyresource limits based on what kind of job it is. If left unspecified, the system will apply lightresource limits to the job, throttling its CPU usage and I/O bandwidth. The following are valid values:   Background   Background jobs are generally processes that do work that was not directly requested by the user.   The resource limits applied to Background jobs are intended to prevent them from disrupting the   user experience.   Standard   Standard jobs are equivalent to no ProcessType being set.   Adaptive   Adaptive jobs move between the Background and Interactive classifications based on activity over   XPC connections. See xpc_transaction_begin(3) for details.   Interactive   Interactive jobs run with the same resource limitations as apps, that is to say, none. Interac-tive Interactive   tive jobs are critical to maintaining a responsive user experience, and this key should only be   used if an app's ability to be responsive depends on it, and cannot be made Adaptive.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Program
options.description: This key maps to the first argument of execvp(3).  If this key is missing, then the first element ofthe array of strings provided to the ProgramArguments will be used instead.  This key is required inthe absence of the ProgramArguments key.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.ProgramArguments
options.description: This key maps to the second argument of execvp(3).  This key is required in the absence of the Programkey. Please note: many people are confused by this key. Please read execvp(3) very carefully!

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.QueueDirectories
options.description: Much like the WatchPaths option, this key will watch the paths for modifications. The difference beingthat the job will only be started if the path is a directory and the directory is not empty.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.RootDirectory
options.description: This optional key is used to specify a directory to chroot(2) to before running the job.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.RunAtLoad
options.description: This optional key is used to control whether your job is launched once at the time the job is loaded.The default is false.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets
options.description: This optional key is used to specify launch on demand sockets that can be used to let launchd know whento run the job. The job must check-in to get a copy of the file descriptors using APIs outlined inlaunch(3).  The keys of the top level Sockets dictionary can be anything. They are meant for the appli-cation applicationcation developer to use to differentiate which descriptors correspond to which application level proto-cols protocolscols (e.g. http vs. ftp vs. DNS...).  At check-in time, the value of each Sockets dictionary key willbe an array of descriptors. Daemon/Agent writers should consider all descriptors of a given key to beto be effectively equivalent, even though each file descriptor likely represents a different networkingprotocol which conforms to the criteria specified in the job configuration file.The parameters below are used as inputs to call getaddrinfo(3).

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.Bonjour
options.description: This optional key can be used to request that the service be registered with themDNSResponder(8).  If the value is boolean, the service name is inferred from the SockService-Name. SockServiceName.Name.
options.type: null or boolean or list of string

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.MulticastGroup
options.description: This optional key can be used to request that the datagram socket join a multicast group.  If thevalue is a hostname, then getaddrinfo(3) will be used to join the correct multicast address for agiven socket family.  If an explicit IPv4 or IPv6 address is given, it is required that the Sock-Family SockFamilyFamily family also be set, otherwise the results are undefined.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SecureSocketWithKey
options.description: This optional key is a variant of SockPathName. Instead of binding to a known path, a securelygenerated socket is created and the path is assigned to the environment variable that is inher-ited inheritedited by all jobs spawned by launchd.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockFamily
options.description: This optional key can be used to specifically request that "IPv4" or "IPv6" socket(s) be created.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockNodeName
options.description: This optional key specifies the node to connect(2) or bind(2) to.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockPassive
options.description: This optional key specifies whether listen(2) or connect(2) should be called on the created filedescriptor. The default is true ("to listen").

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockPathMode
options.description: This optional key specifies the mode of the socket. Known bug: Property lists don't supportoctal, so please convert the value to decimal.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockPathName
options.description: This optional key implies SockFamily is set to "Unix". It specifies the path to connect(2) orbind(2) to.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockProtocol
options.description: This optional key specifies the protocol to be passed to socket(2).  The only value understood bythis key at the moment is "TCP".

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockServiceName
options.description: This optional key specifies the service on the node to connect(2) or bind(2) to.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockType
options.description: This optional key tells launchctl what type of socket to create. The default is "stream" andother valid values for this key are "dgram" and "seqpacket" respectively.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits
options.description: Resource limits to be imposed on the job. These adjust variables set with setrlimit(2).  The followingkeys apply:

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.CPU
options.description: The maximum amount of cpu time (in seconds) to be used by each process.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.Core
options.description: The largest size (in bytes) core file that may be created.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.Data
options.description: The maximum size (in bytes) of the data segment for a process; this defines how far a program mayextend its break with the sbrk(2) system call.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.FileSize
options.description: The largest size (in bytes) file that may be created.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.MemoryLock
options.description: The maximum size (in bytes) which a process may lock into memory using the mlock(2) function.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.NumberOfFiles
options.description: The maximum number of open files for this process.  Setting this value in a system wide daemonwill set the sysctl(3) kern.maxfiles (SoftResourceLimits) or kern.maxfilesperproc (HardResource-Limits) (HardResourceLimits)Limits) value in addition to the setrlimit(2) values.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.NumberOfProcesses
options.description: The maximum number of simultaneous processes for this user id.  Setting this value in a systemwide daemon will set the sysctl(3) kern.maxproc (SoftResourceLimits) or kern.maxprocperuid(HardResourceLimits) value in addition to the setrlimit(2) values.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.ResidentSetSize
options.description: The maximum size (in bytes) to which a process's resident set size may grow.  This imposes alimit on the amount of physical memory to be given to a process; if memory is tight, the systemwill prefer to take memory from processes that are exceeding their declared resident set size.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.Stack
options.description: The maximum size (in bytes) of the stack segment for a process; this defines how far a program'sstack segment may be extended.  Stack extension is performed automatically by the system.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StandardErrorPath
options.description: This optional key specifies what file should be used for data being sent to stderr when using stdio(3).

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StandardInPath
options.description: This optional key specifies what file should be used for data being supplied to stdin when usingstdio(3).

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StandardOutPath
options.description: This optional key specifies what file should be used for data being sent to stdout when using stdio(3).

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval
options.description: This optional key causes the job to be started every calendar interval as specified. Missing argumentsare considered to be wildcard. The semantics are much like crontab(5).  Unlike cron which skips jobinvocations when the computer is asleep, launchd will start the job the next time the computer wakesup.  If multiple intervals transpire before the computer is woken, those events will be coalesced intoone event upon wake from sleep.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Day
options.description: The day on which this job will be run.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Hour
options.description: The hour on which this job will be run.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Minute
options.description: The minute on which this job will be run.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Month
options.description: The month on which this job will be run.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Weekday
options.description: The weekday on which this job will be run (0 and 7 are Sunday).

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartInterval
options.description: This optional key causes the job to be started every N seconds.  If the system is asleep, the job willbe started the next time the computer wakes up.  If multiple intervals transpire before the computer iswoken, those events will be coalesced into one event upon wake from sleep.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartOnMount
options.description: This optional key causes the job to be started every time a filesystem is mounted.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.ThrottleInterval
options.description: This key lets one override the default throttling policy imposed on jobs by launchd.  The value is inseconds, and by default, jobs will not be spawned more than once every 10 seconds.  The principlebehind this is that jobs should linger around just in case they are needed again in the near future.This not only reduces the latency of responses, but it encourages developers to amortize the cost ofprogram invocation.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.TimeOut
options.description: The recommended idle time out (in seconds) to pass to the job. If no value is specified, a default timeout will be supplied by launchd for use by the job at check in time.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Umask
options.description: This optional key specifies what value should be passed to umask(2) before running the job. Known bug:Property lists don't support octal, so please convert the value to decimal.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.UserName
options.description: This optional key specifies the user to run the job as. This key is only applicable when launchd isrunning as root.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.WaitForDebugger
options.description: This optional key specifies that launchd should instruct the kernel to have the job wait for a debuggerto attach before any code in the job is executed.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.WatchPaths
options.description: This optional key causes the job to be started if any one of the listed paths are modified.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.WorkingDirectory
options.description: This optional key is used to specify a directory to chdir(2) to before running the job.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.inetdCompatibility
options.description: The presence of this key specifies that the daemon expects to be run as if it were launched from inetd.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.inetdCompatibility.Wait
options.description: This flag corresponds to the "wait" or "nowait" option of inetd. If true, then the listeningsocket is passed via the standard in/out/error file descriptors. If false, then accept(2) iscalled on behalf of the job, and the result is passed via the standard in/out/error descriptors.

options.title: lib
options.description: This option allows modules to define helper functions,constants, etc.

options.title: manual.html.enable
options.description: Whether to install the HTML manual. This also installs thehome-manager-help tool, which opens a localcopy of the Home Manager manual in the system web browser.

options.title: manual.json.enable
options.description: Whether to install a JSON formatted list of all Home Manageroptions. This can be located at<profile directory>/share/doc/home-manager/options.json,and may be used for navigating definitions, auto-completing,and other miscellaneous tasks.

options.title: manual.manpages.enable
options.description: Whether to install the configuration manual page. The manual canbe reached by man home-configuration.nix.
options.note:
When looking at the manual page pretend that all references to
NixOS stuff are actually references to Home Manager stuff.
Thanks!

options.title: news.display
options.description: How unread and relevant news should be presented whenrunning home-manager build andhome-manager switch.
options.note: The options are

options.description: Do not print anything during build or switch. The      home-manager news command still      works for viewing the entries.
The number of unread and relevant news entries will be      printed to standard output. The home-manager      news command can later be used to view the      entries.
A pager showing unread news entries is opened.

options.title: nix.settings
options.description: Configuration for Nix, seehttps://nixos.org/manual/nix/stable/#sec-conf-file ornix.conf(5) for avalaible options.The value declared here will be translated directly to the key-value pairs Nix expects.
options.note:
Configuration specified in nix.extraOptions which will be appended
verbatim to the resulting config file.
options.type: attribute set of (Nix config atom (null, bool, int, float, str, path or package) or list of (Nix config atom (null, bool, int, float, str, path or package)))

options.title: nixpkgs.config
options.description: The configuration of the Nix Packages collection. (Fordetails, see the Nixpkgs documentation.) It allows you to setpackage configuration options.
options.note:
If null, then configuration is taken from
the fallback location, for example,
~/.config/nixpkgs/config.nix.

options.title: nixpkgs.overlays
options.description: List of overlays to use with the Nix Packages collection. (Fordetails, see the Nixpkgs documentation.) It allows you tooverride packages globally. This is a function that takes asan argument the original Nixpkgs. Thefirst argument should be used for finding dependencies, andthe second should be used for overriding recipes.
options.note:
If null, then the overlays are taken from
the fallback location, for example,
~/.config/nixpkgs/overlays.

options.title: programs.mako.ignoreTimeout
options.description: If set, mako will ignore the expire timeout sent by notificationsand use the one provided by default-timeout instead.

options.title: programs.mako.layer
options.description: Arrange mako at the specified layer, relative to normal windows.Supported values are background, bottom, top, and overlay. Usingoverlay will cause notifications to be displayed above fullscreenwindows, though this may also occur at top depending on yourcompositor.

options.title: programs.mako.margin
options.description: Set margin of each edge specified in pixels. Specify single value toapply margin on all sides. Two comma-seperated values will setvertical and horizontal edges seperately. Four comma-seperated willgive each edge a seperate value.For example: 10,20,5 will set top margin to 10, left and right to 20and bottom to five.

options.title: programs.mako.markup
options.description: If 1, enable Pango markup. If 0, disable Pango markup. If enabled,Pango markup will be interpreted in your format specifier and in thebody of notifications.

options.title: programs.mako.maxIconSize
options.description: Set maximum icon size to the specified number of pixels.

options.title: programs.mako.maxVisible
options.description: Set maximum number of visible notifications. Set -1 to show all.

options.title: programs.mako.output
options.description: Show notifications on the specified output. If empty, notificationswill appear on the focused output. Requires the compositor to supportthe Wayland protocol xdg-output-unstable-v1 version 2.

options.title: programs.mako.padding
options.description: Set padding of each edge specified in pixels. Specify single value toapply margin on all sides. Two comma-seperated values will setvertical and horizontal edges seperately. Four comma-seperated willgive each edge a seperate value.For example: 10,20,5 will set top margin to 10, left and right to 20and bottom to five.

options.title: programs.mako.progressColor
options.description: Set popup progress indicator color to a specific color,represented in hex color code. To draw the progressindicator on top of the background color, use theover attribute. To replace the backgroundcolor, use the source attribute (this canbe useful when the notification is semi-transparent).

options.title: programs.mako.sort
options.description: Sorts incoming notifications by time and/or priority in ascending(+)or descending(-) order.

options.title: programs.mako.textColor
options.description: Set popup text color to a specific color, represented in hex colorcode.

options.title: programs.mako.width
options.description: Set width of notification popups in specified number of pixels.

options.title: programs.man.enable
options.description: Whether to enable manual pages and the mancommand. This also includes "man" outputs of allhome.packages.

options.title: programs.man.package
options.description: The man package to use.

options.title: programs.man.generateCaches
options.description: Whether to generate the manual page index caches usingmandb(8). This allows searching for a page orkeyword using utilities like apropos(1).
options.note:
This feature is disabled by default because it slows down
building. If you don't mind waiting a few more seconds when
Home Manager builds a new generation, you may safely enable
this option.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.keyBindings
options.description: Key bindings mapping keys to commands in different modes. This settingis a dictionary containing mode names and dictionaries mapping keys tocommands: {mode: {key: command}} If you want to mapa key to another key, check the keyMappings settinginstead. For modifiers, you can use either - or+ as delimiters, and these names:
options.note:
Control: Control, Ctrl
  
    Meta: Meta, Windows,
    Mod4
  
    Alt: Alt, Mod1
  
    Shift: Shift
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of string

options.description: Default mode, where most commands are invoked.

Entered when an input field is focused on a website, or by      pressing i in normal mode. Passes through almost all keypresses      to the website, but has some bindings like      <Ctrl-e> to open an external editor.      Note that single keys can’t be bound in this mode.
Entered when f is pressed to select links with the keyboard. Note      that single keys can’t be bound in this mode.

Similar to insert mode, but passes through all keypresses except      <Escape> to leave the mode. It might be      useful to bind <Escape> to some other      key in this mode if you want to be able to send an Escape key to      the website as well. Note that single keys can’t be bound in this      mode.
Entered when pressing the : key in order to enter a command. Note      that single keys can’t be bound in this mode.
Entered when there’s a prompt to display, like for download      locations or when invoked from JavaScript.
Entered when there’s a yes/no prompt displayed.
Entered when pressing the v mode, used to select text using the      keyboard.
Entered when qutebrowser is waiting for a register name/key for      commands like :set-mark.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.keyMappings
options.description: This setting can be used to map keys to other keys. When the key usedas dictionary-key is pressed, the binding for the key used asdictionary-value is invoked instead. This is useful for globalremappings of keys, for example to map Ctrl-[ to Escape. Note that whena key is bound (via bindings.default orbindings.commands), the mapping is ignored.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.searchEngines
options.description: Search engines that can be used via the address bar. Maps a searchengine name (such as DEFAULT, orddg) to a URL with a {}placeholder. The placeholder will be replaced by the search term, use{{ and }} for literal{/} signs. The search engine namedDEFAULT is used whenurl.auto_search is turned on and something else thana URL was entered to be opened. Other search engines can be used byprepending the search engine name to the search term, for example:open google qutebrowser.

options.title: programs.xmobar.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Xmobar, a minimalistic status bar.

options.title: programs.xmobar.package
options.description: Package providing the xmobar binary.

options.title: programs.xmobar.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration lines to add to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/xmobar/.xmobarrc.Seehttps://xmobar.org/#configurationfor options.
options.example:
Config
  { font        = "Fira Code"
  , borderColor = "#d0d0d0"
  , border      = FullB
  , borderWidth = 3
  , bgColor     = "#222"
  , fgColor     = "grey"
  , position    = TopSize C 99 30
  , commands    =
      [ Run Cpu ["-t", "cpu: <fc=#4eb4fa><bar> <total>%</fc>"] 10
      , Run Network "enp3s0" ["-S", "True", "-t", "eth: <fc=#4eb4fa><rx></fc>/<fc=#4eb4fa><tx></fc>"] 10
      , Run Memory ["-t","mem: <fc=#4eb4fa><usedbar> <usedratio>%</fc>"] 10
      , Run Date "date: <fc=#4eb4fa>%a %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S </fc>" "date" 10
      , Run StdinReader
      ]
  , sepChar     = "%"
  , alignSep    = "}{"
  , template    = "  %StdinReader% | %cpu% | %memory% | %enp3s0%  }{%date%  "
  }

options.description: How often to run mbsync.  This value is passed to the systemdtimer configuration as the onCalendar option.  Seesystemd.time(7)for more information about the format.

options.description: An optional command to run after mbsync executes successfully.This is useful for running mailbox indexing tools.

options.description: Extra configuration files read by Mopidy when the service starts.Later files in the list override earlier configuration files andstructured settings.

options.description: Configuration written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/mopidy/mopidy.conf.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes
options.description: Muchsync remotes to synchronise with.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.frequency
options.description: How often to run muchsync. Thisvalue is passed to the systemd timer configuration as theOnCalendar option. Seesystemd.time(7)for more information about the format.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.local.checkForModifiedFiles
options.description: Check for locally modified files.Without this option, muchsync assumes that files in a maildir arenever edited.
options.note:
checkForModifiedFiles disables certain
optimizations so as to make muchsync at least check the timestamp on
every file, which will detect modified files at the cost of a longer
startup time.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.local.importNew
options.description: Whether to begin the synchronisation by runningnotmuch new locally.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.remote.checkForModifiedFiles
options.description: Check for modified files on the remote side.Without this option, muchsync assumes that files in a maildir arenever edited.
options.note:
checkForModifiedFiles disables certain
optimizations so as to make muchsync at least check the timestamp on
every file, which will detect modified files at the cost of a longer
startup time.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.remote.host
options.description: Remote SSH host to synchronize with.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.remote.importNew
options.description: Whether to begin the synchronisation by runningnotmuch new on the remote side.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.remote.muchsyncPath
options.description: Specifies the path to muchsync on the server.Ordinarily, muchsync should be in the default PATH on the serverso this option is not required.However, this option is useful if you have to install muchsync ina non-standard place or wish to test development versions of thecode.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.sshCommand
options.description: Specifies a command line to pass to /bin/shto execute a command on another machine.
options.note:
Note that because this string is passed to the shell,
special characters including spaces may need to be escaped.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.upload
options.description: Whether to propagate local changes to the remote.

scalars or a group itself

options.title: services.polybar.extraConfig
options.description: Additional configuration to add.
options.example:
''
[module/date]
type = internal/date
interval = 5
date = "%d.%m.%y"
time = %H:%M
format-prefix-foreground = \''${colors.foreground-alt}
label = %time%  %date%
''

options.title: services.polybar.script
options.description: This script will be used to start the polybars.Set all necessary environment variables here and start all bars.It can be assumed that polybar executable is in the PATH.Note, this script must start all bars in the background and then terminate.

options.title: services.polybar.settings
options.description: Polybar configuration. This takes a nix attrset and converts it to thestrange data format that polybar uses.Each entry will be converted to a section in the output file.Several things are treated specially: nested keys are convertedto dash-separated keys; the special text key is ignored as a nested key,to allow mixing different levels of nesting; and lists are converted topolybar's foo-0, foo-1, ... format.
options.note: For example:

options.example:

export SDL_VIDEODRIVER=wayland
# needs qt5.qtwayland in systemPackages
export QT_QPA_PLATFORM=wayland
export QT_WAYLAND_DISABLE_WINDOWDECORATION="1"
# Fix for some Java AWT applications (e.g. Android Studio),
# use this if they aren't displayed properly:
export _JAVA_AWT_WM_NONREPARENTING=1
''
